wrench.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to twist and pull something roughly from the place where it is being held
wrench.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I wrenched the packet from his grasp.
The door had been wrenched open.
wrench.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to hurt a joint in your body by twisting it
wrench.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I think Iâ€™ve wrenched my knee.
wrench.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a metal tool that you use for turning nuts
wrench.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a strong feeling of sadness that you get when you leave a person or place that you love
wrench.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Leaving New York had been a terrible wrench.
wrench.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a twisting movement that pulls something violently
wrench.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: He grabbed the rope and gave it a wrench.
